title: 103_hr3060
content: The Act may be cited as the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" and aims to ensure safe, economical, and effective payroll administration. The "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" amends Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, defining 'financial organization' and authorizing electronic transfers for employee pay. The "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" allows the Secretary of the Treasury to require electronic transfers for employee pay if deemed practical and in the interest of economy or effectiveness. The Secretary can require electronic funds transfer for employee pay if practical and in the interest of economy or effectiveness, with safeguards over public funds. Employees must designate a financial organization to receive their payments. The regulation requires employees to designate a financial organization to receive their pay, and the certification must include information about the designated organization. Transfer fees are prohibited. The regulation mandates employees to designate a financial organization for their pay, with required information. Transfer fees are not allowed for payments made by the Secretary. The regulation prohibits financial organizations from charging employees for handling payments authorized by the Secretary. Employees with annual pay below $20,000 can request an exemption from the requirements. The Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act exempts employees with annual pay below $20,000 from certain requirements. National security exceptions are also outlined in the Act. The Director of the Central Intelligence Agency can exempt the agency and its employees from certain regulations if compliance would risk disclosing intelligence sources. The Director or designee can exempt the agency from regulations if disclosure would compromise intelligence sources. Financial organizations accepting payments from the US as authorized by the Secretary are fully acquitted. The United States can make payments in any authorized manner by the Secretary, which will serve as full acquittance for the amount. Additionally, payments to individuals can be made through electronic fund transfers upon request. The Secretary can authorize payments in any manner, and individuals can request payment through electronic fund transfers. Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, is amended to reflect these changes.
